channel.title: Compiling Error
channel.description:
Just got a new computer with Windows 8, and I'm trying to figure things out. I've dealt with this issue with my javac not being recognized as an internal or external command, but I've never had to deal with this error or my compiler as a whole.
[url=http://postimg.org/image/yzp9qap57/][img]http://s1.postimg.org/yzp9qap57/error.jpg[/img][/url] (Click to enlarge)

item.title: Compiling Error
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:545686”]Okay, well. Typically, you don’t compile with JRE.
You want to first change it so you’re looking in the JDK directory.
Second, you’re going to want to add some Environmental Variables so you don’t have to execute compiling and running that way.
How do I set or change the PATH system variable?
After that’s done. Change the batch file’s code so it’s:
javac the-stuff-you-wanna-compile-here[/quote]

Done, thanks.

Read full topic

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:545686”]Okay, well. Typically, you don’t compile with JRE.
You want to first change it so you’re looking in the JDK directory.
Second, you’re going to want to add some Environmental Variables so you don’t have to execute compiling and running that way.
How do I set or change the PATH system variable?
After that’s done. Change the batch file’s code so it’s:
javac the-stuff-you-wanna-compile-here[/quote]

LOL Didn’t realize the jre xD

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling Error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Okay, well. Typically, you don’t compile with JRE.
You want to first change it so you’re looking in the JDK directory.
Second, you’re going to want to add some Environmental Variables so you don’t have to execute compiling and running that way.
How do I set or change the PATH system variable?
After that’s done. Change the batch file’s code so it’s:
javac the-stuff-you-wanna-compile-here

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling Error
item.dc:creator: @Damoiscool Damoiscool
item.description:
@Damoiscool wrote:

[quote=“nolan2131, post:1, topic:545686”]Just got a new computer with Windows 8, and I’m trying to figure things out. I’ve dealt with this issue with my javac not being recognized as an internal or external command, but I’ve never had to deal with this error or my compiler as a whole.


(Click to enlarge)[/quote]

Seriously this is simple stuff. You need to make sure you have jdk lol. If you’re certain you do, right click the compiler, click edit and change the location of javac to where yours is located.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling Error
item.dc:creator: @rmark45matsu rmark45matsu
item.description:
@rmark45matsu wrote:

You need to change your environmental java settings

Read full topic
